decks.notes: The main concept of this Mardu Aggro deck revolves around quickly filling up the graveyard with instants and sorceries to enable cards like Bedlam Reveler and Young Pyromancer. This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize while applying pressure with efficient creatures and burn spells like Lightning Bolt. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Kolaghan's Command and Collective Brutality, along with versatile removal options like Fatal Push and Terminate. Additionally, the inclusion of Lingering Souls provides a resilient threat that can overwhelm the opponent.

This Abzan Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and board with a mix of hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, removal spells like Fatal Push and Path to Exile, and creatures like Tarmogoyf and Siege Rhino that provide a clock while also being resilient threats. The deck also utilizes graveyard synergies with cards like Lingering Souls and Grim Flayer, along with graveyard recursion with Traverse the Ulvenwald and Grisly Salvage. Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope provide additional disruption and value.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble an infinite combo involving Krark-Clan Ironworks, Scrap Trawler, and Myr Retriever to generate a large amount of mana and draw your entire deck. With the inclusion of cards like Darksteel Citadel and Ichor Wellspring, this deck aims to create a loop of sacrificing and recurring artifacts to generate value and eventually win the game through a combo finish. The deck also includes various ways to control the board and find key pieces with cards like Ancient Stirrings and Engineered Explosives.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It utilizes powerful threat cards like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Wurmcoil Engine to control the game and overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes cards to search for and tutor the UrzaTron lands, as well as removal and graveyard hate to disrupt opponent's strategies. The high mana curve and potential for big plays make it a formidable control deck in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling a board of artifact creatures and using them to overwhelm the opponent with damage. By utilizing cards like Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer, along with fast mana sources like Mox Opal, the deck can quickly pump up its creatures and swing for lethal damage in just a few turns. The inclusion of cards like Karn, Scion of Urza and Arcbound Ravager provide additional ways to further enhance the power of the artifact creatures and push for victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan combo to generate a large amount of mana and search for powerful lands. The deck aims to ramp up mana production with cards like Azusa, Lost but Seeking and Sakura-Tribe Scout, while also utilizing cards like Ancient Stirrings and Tolaria West to search for key pieces. The deck also includes utility lands like Ghost Quarter and Bojuka Bog to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck is designed to quickly assemble its combo and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

Fast and aggressive Eldrazi creatures combined with efficient mana acceleration and removal spells to overwhelm opponents in the early game and maintain pressure throughout. The deck aims to capitalize on the Eldrazi tribe's powerful abilities and synergies, using cards like Noble Hierarch and Eldrazi Temple to consistently play threats ahead of curve. By leveraging both speed and disruptive creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher, Eldrazi Aggro looks to close out games quickly before opponents can stabilize or mount a defense.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast creature aggression and disruptive spells. The deck aims to fill the graveyard with card advantage and fuel for Bedlam Reveler while generating tokens with Young Pyromancer and Lingering Souls. The inclusion of removal spells like Fatal Push, Lightning Bolt, and Kolaghan's Command helps control the board and clear a path for attackers. The deck also features hand disruption with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, making it difficult for the opponent to execute their game plan.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays with low cost creatures and burn spells to quickly bring the opponent's life total down. The key strategy is to apply pressure early on with fast creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, while maintaining board control with spells like Lightning Bolt and Searing Blaze. The deck aims to finish off the opponent with direct damage spells like Boros Charm and Lava Spike. The mana base is built to ensure consistent access to all necessary colors for spells, with a focus on red mana sources.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible using efficient burn spells and creatures with haste. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and constant stream of damage, ideally finishing them off before they have a chance to stabilize. With a combination of direct damage spells and aggressive creatures, this deck aims to close out games quickly and efficiently through a relentless offensive strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Bloodghast, Flameblade Adept, and Flamewake Phoenix to bring out big threats like Gurmag Angler and Hollow One. By utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt, Burning Inquiry, and collective Brutality to disrupt the opponent's game plan, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and constant pressure. The deck also includes powerful card draw and discard spells like Faithless Looting and Goblin Lore to keep the engine running smoothly and consistently.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through countering opponent's spells, removing threats from the battlefield, and ultimately winning the game with powerful finishers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria or Entreat the Angels. The deck includes a variety of versatile spells like Cryptic Command, Path to Exile, and Detention Sphere to maintain control over the game. Search for Azcanta and Jace, the Mind Sculptor provide card advantage while Celestial Colonnade serves as a win condition. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through careful resource management and strategic decision-making.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Sakura-Tribe Elder and Farseek in order to cast big threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Primeval Titan. The deck aims to combo off by using cards like Summoner's Pact and Through the Breach to put powerful creatures into play and deal massive amounts of damage with Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle triggers. The inclusion of cards like Lightning Bolt and Sweltering Suns provides removal and control, while also ensuring the deck has options to interact with the opponent.

The main concept of this deck revolves around using Primeval Titan and Scapeshift to quickly ramp up lands and trigger Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle for massive amounts of damage. Bloodbraid Elf and Sakura-Tribe Elder help with early game ramp and card advantage, while Lightning Bolt and Abrade provide removal and utility. The deck aims to consistently hit its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a sudden burst of burn damage from Valakut triggers. The inclusion of cards like Obstinate Baloth and Sweltering Suns helps to deal with aggro decks and stabilize the board when needed.

The key idea in this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Farseek and Sakura-Tribe Elder, while also using cards like Search for Tomorrow to tutor for essential pieces like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. Once enough lands are in play, the player can cast Scapeshift to sacrifice those lands and search for a number of Valakuts and Mountains to deal massive damage to the opponent. Primeval Titan can also help in fetching lands and accelerating the combo. The deck aims to win quickly by chaining together these powerful combo pieces.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Search for Tomorrow and Farseek, while also utilizing cards like Sakura-Tribe Elder to accelerate the process. The ultimate goal is to combo off with Scapeshift and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent's creatures or directly to their face. Cards like Primeval Titan can also help fetch Valakut and ramp up the damage output. The deck aims to efficiently assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful win condition.
